page.title: 08FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: Most of the farm land in our area is arable,very little is wetland.Fields are large in size with no hedges.Only a small amount of land needs to be drained.Very few crops have been damaged by pests.Wheat is the primary crop,but nine others are grown,the newest of which being Oil Seed Rape. There are no unusual crops grown in our area.Mr Newman is one of the Bottisham farmers who owns ten fields of about thirty acres each.Mr Newman grows sugar beet,peas,beans,wheat, barley,oil seed rape and asparagus. Rape is used for making margerine. Beans are used for cattle food and the remaining crops are for human consumption.
